quest.name: Caging the Messenger
journal: Hythlodaeus is pondering what to do next.

Hermes has taken refuge within the observational facility of Ktisis Hyperboreia. Although the reasons to do so are as diverse as the company you keep, it is decided that you will chase down and confront the chief overseer and his creation.

You arrive at the front door to find the facility in a state of alert. The scholars milling outside seem oblivious as to who sounded the alarum or why, but for you and your companions, the circumstances of this emergency are crystal clear. Wary of what other obstacles Hermes may have placed in your path, you assign roles, square your shoulders, and prepare to march into the magically expanded environs of Ktisis Hyperboreia.

※To enlist your companion NPCs for this duty, speak with them near the entrance or access Duty Support via the main menu. Use the Duty Finder if you wish to complete the instance alongside fellow players.

You fight your way through the many fields and floors of the facility until at last you reach the highest platform in Ktisis Hyperboreia. There awaits an unrepentant and transformed Hermes, who refuses to surrender Meteion into the Convocation's custody. A tempestuous battle ensues, but in the end, your efforts to subdue the chief overseer prove successful...

Silent until now, Hermes's question about happiness amongst the stars prompts Meteion to step forward and describe the anguished desperation of the races she encountered. She declares her intention to relieve all life of the burden of existence, and Hermes, after binding your company in chains of aether, accepts this ultimatum as a challenge to the worthiness of mankind. In order to ensure the “fairness” of this determination, the chief summons Kairos to alter the memories of everyone present, such that all that occurred since your arrival in Elpis would be wiped clean. Before the process begins, however, he bids Meteion escape to the edge of the universe, knowing that he will soon believe her and her sisters to have perished in an accident. It is then that Venat breaks her shackles and chases the entelechy into the sky. Likewise freed of your bonds, you and Hythlodaeus distract Hermes, while Emet-Selch tears a hole in the spatial confluence to afford you an escape route. Venat returns from her failed pursuit just in time to have Argos bear you both through the portal and evade the Kairos-induced amnesia. Hythlodaeus and Emet-Selch are not so fortunate, and now it falls to you and Venat to remember─and safeguard─your respective realities.

Rested somewhat from the encounter, you listen in sadness as Venat explains what will likely become of Hermes now that Meteion is gone. In an instant, it seems that so much was lost, but there is much that remains for you to do...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Do you understand why Hermes would do this? His logic escapes me entirely...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: If all Hermes means to do is listen to Meteion's report, then it is his right to do so.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: But once he receives the answers to his question, what then? The fate of the world may very well hinge upon the choice he makes in that moment...and we must be there when he makes it.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Hermes has headed to Ktisis.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Considering the expansive dimensions of the place, even we may have a difficult time locating his aether. All I can say is that he entered from the rooftop, and likely arrived at the uppermost point in the facility.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: So...do we pursue him?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Of course we pursue him. No matter what Hermes might be thinking, Meteion is a potential threat that needs to be brought under our control.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: The Convocation's duty to safeguard this star takes precedence over any personal stake in the matter.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Venat? Forename?

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: 'Tis clear we stand on a precipice, but we have yet to determine beyond a shadow of a doubt that Meteion's is the hand which tips us over the edge.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, if we are to learn the truth of the Final Days, we must give chase. And even if neither Hermes nor Meteion is ultimately responsible, we cannot leave them to suffer this torment alone.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Agreed on all counts. To Ktisis Hyperboreia we go!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I mislike the look of this...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Judging from the crowd, something is afoot.

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: I saw naught out of the ordinary. Does anyone know what caused it?

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: What have we here...?

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Excuse me, has something happened inside Ktisis?

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: Mistress Venat! I'm so glad you're here!

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: No one knows what prompted it, but the alarum was sounded and Ktisis put into a state of alert.

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: Procedure dictated that we evacuate immediately, and we have yet to investigate further...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: ...This is Hermes's doing. Obviously.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: And what does this “state of alert” entail exactly?

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: A field of dampening magick is draped over the entire facility, usually in response to escaped entities and the like.

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: Ktisis scholars and observers are unaffected, but everything─and everyone─else is weakened to a fraction of their usual capabilities.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Then consider us forewarned. We do, however, have urgent business with Chief Hermes, and must enter the premises regardless.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: ...That said, if Hermes is willing to enact such measures, I wonder what other obstacles he has seen fit to drop in our path.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: With that enfeebling spell in place, we're not like to be at our fighting best.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: And I was hardly an effective combatant to begin with! I've little to offer beyond my aetherial vision.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Then you will put that talent of yours to good use. You were fairly skilled at spotting weaknesses, if I recall.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: “Fairly skilled”? Now you've gone and raised everyone's expectations...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: You all need only make the most of your strengths, and I will fill in the gaps as required.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: I was once Azem, after all. 'Twas my job to rise to the occasion─be that as defender, aggressor, or healer.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: I feel better about my lack of prowess already!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: And you, Emet-Selch, can impress us with your arcane majesty. You lob potent spells as easily as breathing, but can also channel that power in a protective manner if you so choose, yes?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Eh!? Well, yes, should the situation call for it...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Excellent! That should cover us on all fronts.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Your tale led us here, Forename, so 'tis only right that you lead us now. No matter what lies ahead, we will win through to Hermes and Meteion.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: And then we will face the future together!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Small talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Form a party and enter Ktisis Hyperboreia.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: From the moment we met you, our visit has devolved into a never-ending series of complications and irritations. In spite of this, I have gained one useful thing:

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: An awareness of dynamis. To think that a power with the potential to corrupt aether had largely escaped our notice...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Whether or not I believe your tale, the facts underpinning your narrative will be the source of much debate.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: So understand that I act not for the sake of you or your fantastical quest. My duty demands that I apprehend Meteion─and if that now means Hermes as well, then so be it.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: I said that Hermes was likely perched somewhere at the highest point of the facility, but reaching him will be no mean feat.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: To put it simply, Ktisis Hyperboreia contains a multitude of vast spaces linked together at the seams, meaning the interior is far more massive than even this grand structure might otherwise suggest.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: But even a colossal facility filled top to bottom with savage creations will not stop you─not with Venat and Emet-Selch at your side. And I will be there too, of course, cheering you on!

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Bleak as the contents of Meteion's report might be, many could hear it and remain content with their lives.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: But not Hermes. For him, the veneer of perfection has long been cracked, and it was to the distant heavens he looked for the means to repair it.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: I understand his anguish after a fashion─my own refusal to return is in opposition to the world's established order.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Yet for me, the imperfections only enhance the fragile beauty of our star. I will fight to see it delivered from destruction, warts and all.

dialogue.name: HYPERBOREIASTAFF
dialogue.text: I will not seek to impede such an august company from going about its business. But please, do be aware that many of the specimens within are far from docile.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Are you feeling at all recovered? I understand that your exertions were more than purely physical, but resting one's body, if only for a moment, is never without merit.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: As for Hermes... I think it unlikely he will create more entelechies.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: He poured much of himself into Meteion, and now that she and her sisters are gone─dissipated, in his mind─the grief must be unbearable.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: He will blame himself. He will believe that, had he never acknowledged his dissatisfaction with the world, then the Meteia would have never been born to suffer and die.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: The offer to join the Fourteen will be a welcome distraction, and one day hence, he will face the advent of the Final Days in the role of Fandaniel...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now enter Ktisis Hyperboreia with a party of NPC avatars. To make use of this feature, open the Trust interface located under Duty in the main menu.

obj.n: Thou Must Live, Die, and Know
